intro: Forasaccus giganteus, commonly known as the giant saccate fern, is a tropical plant characterized by its large, compound fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit with long, segmented stems that support its expansive foliage. Its fronds are usually bi- or tri-pinnate, with a distinctive saccate structure on the undersides of the pinnae. Forasaccus giganteus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
